meanings.definition: A sailing ship with three or more masts, typically with the foremast smaller than the others.
meanings.sent1: The barques sailed gracefully across the ocean, their tall masts reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent2: The harbor was filled with colorful barques, each one ready to set sail on a new adventure.
meanings.sent3: The barques decided to have a race to see which one was the fastest, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the barques looked like majestic giants against the horizon, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing against the barques created a soothing melody for all aboard.

meanings.definition: A small sailing vessel with two or more masts.
meanings.sent1: The tiny barques bobbed up and down in the gentle waves, their sails billowing in the wind.
meanings.sent2: Tourists enjoyed exploring the historic town on the coast, where colorful barques lined the docks.
meanings.sent3: The barques in the bay seemed to be gossiping with each other, swaying back and forth in conversation.
meanings.sent4: The barques were like graceful dancers on the water, moving in perfect harmony with the sea.
meanings.sent5: Children played pirates on the old barques, imagining grand adventures on the high seas.
